name: The Opal San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a business trip my husband joined me in San Francisco. It was a pre-Christmas present for him as he'd never been in the city before, and I wanted a hotel that represented the local flavor. I got an excellent deal at the hotel's webpage, and even though the reviews were mixed, I chose it because of the location, the breakfast and the fact that it was an old building. The room we got was in a pristine state, very cozy and warm. Brad, the nice gentleman at the Front Desk, was very friendly and very helpful. The dinner adjacent to the hotel was a life saver and when we asked for a bottle opener it was delivered to our room in less than 10 minutes. Although sometimes you could hear your neighbors, it was nothing disturbing. Parking was easy and inside the property, and yes, they charge $28/day but it is San Francisco. Both of us work for a hotel in San Diego, and were very pleased with the place and the staff. Would definitely go back there and recommend it to friends/family.
reviews.title: Great San Francisco property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked with Hotwire. CLAIMED to be a 3 star hotel. I would not rate it more than a 1 star. The hotel is old and the hallways smell awful. The room is very small and the bathroom is very minimal - didn't even provide bath soap, a leaning chest for a closet. Parking is expensive.
reviews.title: Would NOT stay at the Opal next time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very small for a deluxe room especially the bathroom. And since there wasn't any street parking available we had to pay $28.50 a night to park in their garage; therefore not saving any money by booking on line. The view from our window - the side of the next building. It was very clean and staff friendly but wouldn't stay again unless we fly down.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

likes.liked: — It was very clean and quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: got a room on the top floor.. got a good deal.. basic breakfast and kind of chemical smell in the room but it was clean and comfortable.. housekeeping staff did very good job also. good deal for what I paid and wanted..
reviews.title: good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008
reviews.text: We booked this hotel on hotwire. It's definitely in the Tenderloin and that isn't going to be something every traveler wants to deal with. I was traveling with my inlaws who were a little unsettled by the dirty streets, homeless people, and general vibe of the area. I used to live in SF and live in a major city now, but like I said, that's not for everyone.
reviews.title: Basic hotel, central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We actually got a great rate directly thru the hotel web site. The beds are terribly uncomfortable but otherwise the room was pretty nice. It's an older hotel but well kept up. We were on the top floor which was very nice and quiet. Shower had great water pressure and plenty of hot water. Windows seem newer and kept out a lot of noise. It's not necessarily within walking distance of much though had a great little coffee/bagel place a couple doors down. I stayed here for the marathon and appreciated not being too close to the start line and away enough from the noise. I would recommend it to friends/family and would probably stay there again.
reviews.title: Good for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for a hotel with proximity to downtown San Fran and a reasonable price-point. This one was a diamond in the rough.
reviews.title: Clean, good location and excellent for the price-point hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have been to San Fran several times and stayed in different hotels, so we feel we can offer an experienced review of this hotel (and we felt compelled to give back to the TripAdvisor community -- commercial reviews & corporate marketing gibberish is for the birds).
reviews.title: The Opal was Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid a bit more than normal, but it was a VERY busy weekend (June 7th/8th) in San Fran, so the availability was limited. However, for the price range, this is an excellent hotel. The rooms were surprisingly large, the hotel was charming, the staff friendly and the breakfast was decent. Everything you'd expect from a hotel in this price range.
reviews.title: Reliable public bus service on doorstep and own bathroom !!

likes.liked: — Convenient location for the price we paid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only criticism we have (and it is minor) was with the way breakfast was setup. Likely not a problem under normal circumstances, but one morning there happened to be a couple tour-bus groups staying at the hotel, and the self-serve breakfast was not set up to accomodate such a large rush of people. In the future, it would be good if the hotel could open up some extra space or organize something separate for these tour-bus groups as it was quiet a chaotic scene.
reviews.title: Absolute Rubbish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Based on the reviews I had seen on here, I was initially a bit afraid to stay here. However, I was not disappointed by my stay in any way.
reviews.title: Decent hotel in almost shady area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: First off, Opal is an old hotel, so don't expect to be staying in the Hilton or anything like that.
reviews.title: I would stay there again

likes.liked: — the old Victorian charm, good value
likes.disliked: — toilet that doesnt flush very well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impressions: The airport shuttle drove me straight to the hotel. The lobby is clean, and it appears that the hotel is well kept up. The front desk man who helped us was very nice, and answered all of our questions. He gave us a map and told us how to get to the places we wanted to go. So far, so good.
reviews.title: Beyond Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room: I walked in and was surprised at how large the bedroom was. Two queen sized (I think) beds for three of us, and more than enough room to stretch out. The room was clean, the sheets were clean, no problems there.
reviews.title: Great location and value

likes.liked: — the quiet and clean room, the free contiinental breakfast, and the workout room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The bathroom: This is where I usually worry the most, because this is normally the place where housekeepers neglect to clean as thoroughly as needed, and I've seen some reviews on here about that. But no problems there either. I always look for stray hairs on the floor, toilet, or sink, and didn't see any. It was clearly an old bathroom with an old tub, old sink... but by old, I don't mean unkept or kitsch. Just old-fashioned.
reviews.title: Great Room and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We loved the Opal! It was clean. VERY close to public transportation. Extremely helpful and pleasant desk staff. Tea and Coffee in lobby 24/7. Free internet! A perfectly adequate Continental Breakfast.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plenty of places nearby to eat.
reviews.title: Not worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given an upgrade to a king bed, which was great. Our room had plenty of storage. Fellow travelers had a junior Suite that was really nice.
reviews.title: Terrible Hotel

likes.liked: — I lost my ID and the front desk called to return it (I tipped them $10 for their trouble)
likes.disliked: — Being accused of smoking in the room and being charged a $250 fee, the disappearance of a bag of souveneirs

reviews.title: Hmmm....cheap I guess!
reviews.text: This hotel is very well located with just a short walk to all the main attractions in the center of San Fran'. The rate is really cheap for a city hotel and when you get to your room you see why. We were told we had been upgraded but our room was really small for a family of four. Two double beds and that was pretty much it, no space for anything else. The room was clean, but was very old and shabby feeling, the same with the bathroom. Mel's diner, right next door, was great. This hotel does border the Tenderloin but we did not experience any problems, our cab driver was saying that its very rare for tourists to experience crime in the city, unless you are walking around a bad area at 4am or something like that. Overall, if you are in San Fran on a very tight budget I would recommend staying at this hotel, if you can afford to pay a little more, I would suggest you look at other options. I will probably look elsewhere next time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Booked a non-smoking room a week prior to my stay yet was given a smoking room upon arrival. They re-sold my room due to the fact I arrived at 2am for booking. The rooms are located in a maze of run down hallways and corridors which of course lead to the outside shabby smoking rooms. The best part of the hotel is the central location within the city and Mel's Diner downstairs. Other than that the parking was hard to find, expensive ($29/night) considering you are staying at the hotel already, and AAA discounts were not applied to any of the prices.
reviews.title: Shabby rooms, bait-n-switch tactics

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We booked our reservation online for two rooms with two double beds per room. When we got there they wanted a deposit of $50.00 per night which I thought was ridiculous. I work in the hotel industry and most hotels charge a flat deposit of $100.00. Well, after after checking in we went up to our rooms to find that they had given us two rooms with one king size bed rather than two doubles. Upon calling the front desk staff who were most rude to us to explain that this was not what we had reserved they explained that they didn't have what we reserved and that they gave us a free "upgrade" and that if we did want two double beds that we would have to pay more. So why would we pay more if the king size beds were an "upgrade". So we accepted the room and inquired if we could at least get a rollaway bed. We were then told that if we wanted a rollaway bed it would cost us $15.00 a day. Need less to say some of us slept on the floor.
reviews.title: shockingly bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathtub had a slow drain which made showering uncomfortable. The breakfast was severly lacking. The stairwells are extemely narrow and steep. And it took over a week to get my deposit back. I have stayed at motels that were better than this poor excuse for a hotel. I work in the hotel industry in Waikiki, Hawaii and they way we were treated by the staff I'm surprised you have any guests there at all.
reviews.title: Great Value
